thread.title: Biden Confirms He And Obama Were Briefed On Russian ‘Dossier’
thread.title_full: Biden Confirms He And Obama Were Briefed On Russian ‘Dossier’

author: Randy DeSoto
title: Biden Confirms He And Obama Were Briefed On Russian ‘Dossier’
text:
Trump Warns His Sons: Do A Good Job Or ‘You’re Fired’ 
Trump also tweeted about the matter on Friday: It now turns out that the phony allegations against me were put together by my political opponents and a failed spy afraid of being sued…. 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 13, 2017 Totally made up facts by sleazebag political operatives, both Democrats and Republicans – FAKE NEWS! Russia says nothing exists. Probably… 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 13, 2017 released by "Intelligence" even knowing there is no proof, and never will be. My people will have a full report on hacking within 90 days! 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 13, 2017 
As reported by Western Journalism , Trump adviser Kellyanne Conway challenged CNN’s Anderson Cooper on Wednesday to account for the network’s coverage of the unsubstantiated reports. 
When Cooper charged that the Trump team’s real beef should be with BuzzFeed, Conway noted that CNN ran the story first on air Tuesday night, which BuzzFeed then picked up on. 
The outlet later headlined a story online , “Intel chiefs presented Trump with claims of Russian efforts to compromise him,” in which it directly referenced and linked to the BuzzFeed story. 
Cooper denied it saying, “We’re not linking to the BuzzFeed report.” Fact-check: Ahead of my spirited interview with @AC360 , here is @CNN report linking AND discussing BuzzFeed report. pic.twitter.com/nVoKLTOKMz 
— Kellyanne Conway (@KellyannePolls) January 12, 2017 
But as Conway’s tweet clearly shows, CNN, in fact, did link to the story. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
